entry.title: Lachin corridor remains closed even after Russia delivers aid

media:group.media:title: Lachin corridor remains closed even after Russia delivers aid
media:group.media:description:
üìçKarabakh plans to distribute limited humanitarian aid only to vulnerable families. The Russian-facilitated aid arrived to Karabakh through Azerbaijan. üìçArmenia plans to join the International Criminal Court without seeking any sort of carve-out that would allow Russia‚Äôs Vladimir Putin to visit the country, whom the tribunal issued an arrest warrant for earlier this year.

entry.title: Young volunteers in Karabakh deliver food to those in need

media:group.media:title: Young volunteers in Karabakh deliver food to those in need
media:group.media:description:
For the last two months, 16-year-old Karabakh resident Nare has been volunteering to help deliver food to those in need. The critical shortages in food, medicine, and other supplies in Nagorno Karabakh (Artsakh) are a result of the 9-month illegal blockade by Azerbaijan. The lack of fuel means that any available resources can be acquired only by those who are able to travel long distances on foot. For the ill and the elderly, this is impossible on most days
Initially, Nare was tasked with delivering bread from bakeries to the elderly who were unable to stand in long lines, but as bread shortages worsened, the mission shifted. Now, Nare and the team also deliver food from a local soup kitchen, doing whatever they can to support their community.

entry.title: Armenia's balancing act between Russia and the west

media:group.media:title: Armenia's balancing act between Russia and the west
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of INSIGHTS, Eric breaks down the events surrounding the ongoing blockade of Nagorno-Karabakh by Azerbaijan and Armenia's delicate balancing act as it gradually attempts to reduce Kremlin domination.
He analyzes Russia's growing frustration over Yerevan's refusal to bow to Moscow's demands.
The episode also examines the most hotly contested mayoral race in Yerevan's history, as candidates stake out positions in an election that is broadly viewed as a referendum on the ruling party.
Tensions are high as citizens vote on the future direction of the nation amid threats in Karabakh and pressures from abroad. Tune in for Eric's expert analysis and discussion on where Armenia goes from here in the face of regional turmoil.

entry.title: EU, Russia, US call on Baku to open Karabakh corridor for aid

media:group.media:title: EU, Russia, US call on Baku to open Karabakh corridor for aid
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe European Union, Russia, and United States called on Azerbaijan to partially reopen the Lachin corridor to allow humanitarian organizations to supply aid to Karabakh. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry reported one soldier killed in an apparent death by suicide. üìçThe Artsakh Defense Army reported one soldier sustained non-life-threatening injuries after Azerbaijani units opened fire at his position.

entry.title: Richard Giragosian: United States in the Caucasus

media:group.media:title: Richard Giragosian: United States in the Caucasus
media:group.media:description:
Richard Giragosian, the head of Yerevan-based Regional Studies Center, spoke about the United States‚Äô policy in the South Caucasus at an international symposium on Russia organized by the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey in Yerevan and Tsaghkadzor, Armenia, on July 2-12, 2023.

‘µ÷Ä÷á’°’∂’®, ’®’∂’§’∞’°’∂’∏÷Ç÷Ä ’°’º’¥’°’¥’¢, ’∞’´’∂’£ ’£’¨’≠’°’æ’∏÷Ä ’∞’°’ø’°’Ø’°’£’´’Æ ’ß ’∏÷Ç’∂’•÷Å’•’¨‚Ä§ ’æ’•÷Ä’ª’´’∂’® ’∞’°’Ω’ø’°’ø’æ’•’¨ ’ß 2005-’´’∂, ’Ω’°’∞’¥’°’∂’æ’°’Æ ’ß ’•’≤’•’¨ ’¥’´’∂’π÷á 2020-’®, ’Ω’°’Ø’°’µ’∂ ’¥’´’∂’π÷á ’∂’∏÷Ä’´ ’∞’°’Ω’ø’°’ø’∏÷Ç’¥’® ’°’µ’∂ ’∑’°÷Ä’∏÷Ç’∂’°’Ø’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß ’£’∏÷Ä’Æ’•’¨÷â ‘±’µ’Ω÷Ö÷Ä ‘µ÷Ä÷á’°’∂’´ ’∂’∏÷Ä ’£’¨’≠’°’æ’∏÷Ä ’∞’°’ø’°’Ø’°’£’´’Æ’® ÷Ñ’°’≤’°÷Ñ’°’µ’´’∂ ’°’º’°’ª’´’Ø’° ’®’∂’ø÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´ ÷Ü’∏’∂’´’∂ ÷Ñ’∂’∂’°÷Ä’Ø’æ’∏’≤ ’£’¨’≠’°’æ’∏÷Ä ’©’•’¥’°’∂’•÷Ä’´÷Å ’ß÷â ‘ª’û’∂’π ’•’∂ ’°’Ω’∏÷Ç’¥ ÷Ñ’°’≤’°÷Ñ’°’∫’•’ø’´ ’©’•’Ø’∂’°’Æ’∏÷Ç’∂’•÷Ä’®, ÷Ñ’°’≤’°÷Ñ’°’µ’´’∂ ’∫’¨’°’∂’°’æ’∏÷Ä’¥’°’∂ ’¥’°’Ω’∂’°’£’•’ø’∂’•÷Ä’®, ÷Ñ’°’≤’°÷Ñ’°’∫’•’ø’°÷Ä’°’∂’® ÷á ’∞’°’Ø’°’Ø’∏’º’∏÷Ç’∫÷Å’´’∏’∂ ’¥’°÷Ä’¥’´’∂’∂’•÷Ä’®÷â

media:group.media:title: Russia has ‚Äòno problems‚Äô with Armenia, Putin insists
media:group.media:description:
üìçA Russian truck with desperately needed humanitarian aid reached Karabakh after an unexplained delay while transiting through Azerbaijan. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Nikol Pashinyan and Turkey‚Äôs Recep Tayyip Erdoƒüan pledged to ‚Äúcontinue diplomatic efforts‚Äù to resolve the escalating crisis in the region. üìçArmenia began joint military exercises with the United States. üìçRussian President Vladimir Putin appeared to downplay the growing rift between Yerevan and Moscow, insisting he has ‚Äúno problems with Armenia.‚Äù üìçCroatia defeated Armenia in a Euro-2024 qualifying match.
